item.description: This photograph shows Soviet cosmonaut Alexei Leonov, the first human to perform a spacewalk in 1965. His pioneering EVA during the Voskhod 2 mission proved that humans could work outside their spacecraft, paving the way for all future extravehicular activities. Leonov’s achievement remains one of the most iconic milestones in the history of space exploration.

The photo highlights the utilitarian design and engineering focus of the Soviet approach to human spaceflight.

This structure influences planetary magnetospheres and the space environment around Earth.
